title: Muslims are NOT selling Biryani with pills to make Hindus impotent; here’s the fact check | Newsmobile
author: newsmobile.in
vclaim:
A post is being widely shared on social media which features a set of pictures including a picture of a man serving biryani, a few medicines, and a cop.

It is being claimed that Muslims in Coimbatore are selling Biryani to Hindus laced with pills to make them impotent.

At the time of filing this report, the above post was shared by over 3,600 Facebook users.

ALSO READ: Fact Check: Video of a man being assaulted in Bangladesh shared…

NewsMobile fact-checked the above post and found that the claim made in the above post is FAKE.

Earlier in March, Coimbatore City Police took it to Twitter to clarify that the post in circulation is FAKE.

We further investigated the origin of the pictures in circulation by putting them through Reverse Image Search on different search engines.

The picture of medicine in the viral post is actually from Sri Lanka. The picture was originally published in a report by Sri Lankan newspaper, The Daily Mirror dated May 02, 2019.

We found that the picture of the man serving Biryani is quite old. The search led us to a WordPress article dated January 19, 2017, which featured several food videos and one of the videos have the same thumbnail.

The picture of cops is from Bijnor. Bijnor Police had tweeted the picture on their official Twitter handle on July 11, 2019.

In conclusion, upon analysing our discoveries we can confirm that the claim attached to the pictures is FAKE.
